name: Batumi
fun_fact: Fun fact: Batumi is home to the mesmerizing Ali and Nino statue - two 8-meter-tall moving figures that merge together every 10 minutes at 7 PM, telling the tragic love story between a Muslim Azerbaijani youth and a Christian Georgian princess!

hero_dishes.name: Adjarian Khachapuri
hero_dishes.description: Batumi's signature dish - a boat-shaped bread filled with butter and cheese, topped with a runny egg. The boat shape represents Batumi's heritage as a Black Sea port town.
hero_dishes.origin_story: Batumi is the capital of Adjara, the namesake region for Adjarian khachapuri. Locals declare the boat-like shape is due to Batumi being a port town on the Black Sea.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Retro (essential stop for the best Adjarian Khachapuri in Batumi), Porto Franco (serves the best iteration with unmatched taste and service)

hero_dishes.name: Khinkali
hero_dishes.description: Dumplings shaped like a pocket with various fillings, usually meat, though you can also find versions with mushrooms, salty cheese, or potatoes. Eaten by hand, holding the twisted top.
hero_dishes.origin_story: A beloved Georgian staple that showcases the country's dumpling-making tradition, with each region having its own variation.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Tavaduri (famous for best khinkali in the city, including the mama khinkali - a giant khinkali filled with ten baby khinkali inside), Pirosmani (immaculate khinkali), Khinkali House Kalakuri (authentic, only meat and cheese varieties)

hero_dishes.name: Fresh Black Sea Seafood
hero_dishes.description: Being right by the Black Sea, Batumi offers exceptionally fresh and flavorful seafood, from fish to shellfish.
hero_dishes.origin_story: Batumi's location on the Black Sea coast makes it a prime destination for seafood lovers, with daily catches served at waterfront restaurants.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Fishlandia (near the fish market with terrace overlooking the Black Sea, fresh seafood at reasonable prices)

hero_dishes.name: Georgian Classics
hero_dishes.description: Traditional Georgian dishes including kharcho (hearty soup), mtsvadi (grilled meat skewers), and fresh Georgian salad with tomatoes and cucumbers.
hero_dishes.origin_story: Georgian cuisine is one of the world's oldest, with recipes passed down through generations and influenced by the Silk Road.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Kiziki (massive menu balancing authentic Georgian and international dishes), Panorama Restaurant (Georgian classics with breathtaking Black Sea views)

signature_drinks.name: Georgian Wine
signature_drinks.description: Georgia is one of the world's oldest wine-producing regions, with 8,000 years of winemaking tradition using the qvevri (clay vessel) method.
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Served generously at restaurants like Khinkali House Kalakuri, paired with khinkali and other Georgian dishes. Wine pours are famously generous in Batumi.

food_culture_notes: Batumi is famous for both beaches and architecture, but also its rich and diverse food scene
You can try everything from fresh Black Sea seafood to hot, cheesy khachapuri
Adjarian khachapuri is the regional specialty - boat-shaped bread with cheese, butter, and egg
Khinkali are eaten by hand - hold the twisted top, bite, sip the juice, then eat
Traditional Georgian restaurants serve food that feels like home cooking
The mama khinkali at Tavaduri is a spectacle - waiter cuts it open at your table to reveal baby khinkali inside
